description:
I have installed nova client on my local machine and trying to use nova-client using following command
nova --os_usernmame=admin --os_passwo=xxxxx --os_tenant_name=demo --os_auth_url=http://10.99.130.230:5000/v2.0/ net_list

It is showing maximum tries exceeded for url : /v1.1/e72a1350522c4b9ea9b69661bc4ed265/os-tenant-networks

is there anything extra that I need to supply additionally to make this command work?
title: nova net-list not working on client side

comments.content:
I have installed nova client on my local machine and trying to use nova-client using following command
nova --os_usernmame=admin --os_passwo=xxxxx --os_tenant_name=demo --os_auth_url=http://10.99.130.230:5000/v2.0/ net_list

It is showing maximum tries exceeded for url : /v1.1/e72a1350522c4b9ea9b69661bc4ed265/os-tenant-networks

is there anything extra that I need to supply additionally to make this command work?
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~vivek-vishukla

comments.content: Can you add '--debug' to the list of options and provide relevant output from that?  And I'm guessing this is a devstack install?  Is it possible to provide n-api logs?
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~alaski

comments.content:
nova --os_username=admin --os_passwo=patni --os_tenant_name=demo --os_auth_url=http://10.99.130.230:5000/v2.0/ --debug net-list

comments.content:
Can you provide the output from running just the curl command below, with appropriate token: 

curl -i http://localhost:8774/v1.1/e72a1350522c4b9ea9b69661bc4ed265/os-tenant-networks -X GET -H "X-Auth-Project-Id: demo" -H "User-Agent: python-novaclient" -H "Accept: application/json" -H "X-Auth-Token: bf803962dfcc4fde8bc915b86373db59"

And are there nova api logs from this request?

As far as I can tell at the moment there's something preventing the client from actually connecting to the nova api service.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~alaski
